comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: NYT of December 6, 1915 select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=FA0C15F7395D1673... indicates that the Santa Claus Assocation was a charity providing gifts to needy children (and accepting letters to Santa). It mentions a "heaquarters" in the Clarendon Hotel in Brooklyn. Another NYT article select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F0091FFA3E5F1773... mentiones offices in the Woolworth building.
